choices: Walk around the room for clues
1.content:
As Sara opened her eyes she noted that she could see practically nothing. The room she was in was almost pitch black, several dark grey shapes the only indication that there was a tiny bit of light.

Where am I? her mind began to whirl. The night before she'd enjoyed a night out with her friends on holiday. She had a good time but didn't expect to wake up alone in a place she didn't know. She shook her head to ward off the last remnants of sleep and stoof up, hoping her eyes would adjust to the darkness.

"Em?" she called out, hoping she was just in her room, her best friend near by. But she got no reply.

A sense of panic began to wash over her body. She felt goose bumps rise on her flesh.

"Em?" she called a little louder, her voice shaky. It echoed.

My voice shouldn't be echoing.

She shuffled her feet forward her arms reaching wildly to prevent herself from crashing into any unknown objects.

What now
1.title: Sara awakens..

choices: Try to find where the voice is coming from.
Look for a light or a way out.
Oh, look, what's that over there...?
Sit down, stay still, and hope someone finds you.
11.content:
Rather than just stand there, Sara decided to look around, maybe find a light switch, or better yet, a way out. This room gave her the creeps. The darkness seemed to swirl around her, and the abstract forms beckoned to her, wanting to lure her into an even deeper darkness. Sara waved her hands around her, stepping carefully, trying her best to avoid those looming shapes.

Suddenly Sara stopped. She thought she heard something. Her heart pounded sickeningly in her throat. There, she had definitely heard something. Or someone.

"Hello?" whispered a small, tinny voice. "Hello? Hello?"

Sara turned around slowly, trying to determine the direction the voice was coming from. She wasn't sure if she would avoid it or go towards it if she could discover where it came from. Unfortunately, no matter how hard she listened, she could not determine the source of the little voice. Trying to calm herself down, Sara decided it was probably a broken toy or something. 'Maybe this is like The Island of Misfit Toys,' Sara thought with grim humor. 'Except in a room.'

As Sara continued to wander, she heard the voice, continuing to call out. It scared Sara witless. She wasn't even sure what she wanted to do anymore...
11.title: Walk around the room for clues

choices: long spindly spider legs grasped her arms
two metallic robotic hands hoisted her up
111.content:
Sara took a deep breath and sat down on the damp floor. She put her back to the wall and listened. The voice continued to repeat "Hello" and she began to discern that for every one spoken, two more seemed to be echoes. Strange That is why it was hard to figure out where it was coming from.

She crawled two steps to the center of the room and sat again. She closed her eyes and focused on the first word in the series of hellos. It seemed to come from above. She had already walked the length of each wall and found nothing so it made sense.

She stood up and decided to walk the walls again this time with her hands reaching up as far as they could. she found that she could touch the ceiling of the room. Yuck! Spiderwebs! She grimaced as she waved her hands through one corner. She brought them down again and wiped off the sticky stuff. what if a spider crawled on her. She didn't like spiders. They creeped her out so much she couldn't even kill one in fear of...well, she didn't know what. She always just moved away or had someone else deal with them.

Suddenly she had a thought. Spiders don't talk , do they? What if... oh no. I am not going there.{/e} She shook her head and breathed in again. The air in the room smelled of mold.

She continued her arm scan of the walls and corners, hoping not to find the maker of the webs. Her fear of staying here superseded the other. The next corner yielded more webs but the voice sounded closer.

"Hello," the tinny voice said and it echoed.

Sara chanced a response, "Where are you?" and heard her own echo two times as well. It reminded her of the underground tombs and caverns she had read about. They were not as small as this one and were connected to tunnels. She began to get excited, maybe... her thoughts were interrupted as she got to the last corner. There were not webs and her hands did not touch the ceiling, but an open space. The voice was even more real too as if coming from out side the room now it echoed less.

"Hello, are you up there?" she called. she stood on tiptoe trying to reach up and find a way to boost herself. Suddenly...
111.title: Try to find where the voice is coming from.

1112.content: "Hello?" the robot said, looking at her questioningly. It held her up as though she were some strange thing it had never seen before. "Ummm, hello." replied Sara. "I'm Sara." She figured she aught to introduce herself. It was only polite. "I am anamatronic 1." It said, putting her down on the mossy cubby-hole. It seemed the robot, or whatever it was, had made a bit of a home in a cubby hole in this...cave-thing. When it heard her voice, it hoisted her up so that it could....what? "What are you doing up here?" she asked. "I fell." it replied. Sara nodded, "Long way to fall. Are you broken?" It looked confusedly to the left, then to the right, lifting it's arms and checking it's body. Suddenly it stopped, closed it's eyes and a humming began. After a while the humming stopped and the robot opened it's eyes. "Functioning within normal parameters." it explained, then cocked it's head, examining Sara. "Are you?" it asked, seeming concerned. "I...I don't think so." said Sara. The robot nodded matter-of-factly, "Good." it stated. "Good." she agreed. "Can I call you Ann? Are you a girl? Or should I call you one?" The robot thought a minute then decided, "You may call me one." Sara nodded then began looking at her new surroundings. There seemed no way out. There was a light coming from above...'sunlight?'she thought, "Sunlight!" exclaimed Sara. "How can we get out of here, One?" she asked, excited. Her excitement turned quickly to a foreboding feeling, pressing on her chest as the robot began to laugh.
1112.title: two metallic robotic hands hoisted her up

choices: Go back to the room with the voice
Think  some more about what to do
112.content:
Avoiding the voice, Sara pressed her hands against a wall and slowly shuffled along, feeling carefully for any hint of a door or window. After a few sidesteps, she felt what must be the edge of a door. She found the doorknob and it turned, The door was unlocked!

Unfortunately, it opened into more darkness, but Sara felt she was making progress. Or was she? After all, she could be working her way OUT of something, or she could be working her way deeper INTO something. She stopped and thought hard. There didn't seem to be any logical way to decide which it was. There wasn't a trace of light and the only sound was that tinny voice in the other room saying, "Hello! Hello!"

Maybe she should go back?
112.title: A way out! Or is it?

113.content:
That's when her foot kicked a small object.

Huh, Sara thought. I wonder what that is. Do I dare pick it up?

With a deep breath, she reached down to poke the object she managed to kick. It didn't react and seemed to have some sort of crisscross pattern on at least one side. She ran her finger along and determined it to be cylindrical in shape. Shrugging, she picked it up and tried to examine it closer. Her fingers hit a soft pad, and pressing it caused a stream of light to hit the wall.

"Oh good. Light," Sara muttered to herself. "Guess it's nice to confirm that the room is in fact full of blackness."

"Hello?"

That damn voice. Well, at least I have a little better plan now to figure out what it is.

Sara did another sweep of the room with the flashlight. She spotted outlines of shelves painted in black and a couple dust bunnies. Just as she thought her efforts would lead her nowhere, she found a crevice in the wall wide enough to stick her hand in. Though she saw the crevice, something specifically made her focus on it....
113.title: Oh, look, what's that over there...?

choices: She let out a blood curdling scream.
She smiled and sat up in the bed.
114.content:
The tinny voice was still calling her name, " Sara, Sara" what could it be?. An icy cold shiver passed through her body. As she stumbled around the junk laiden room, in blind panic, through the pitch darkness, her shins hit the hard metal frame of the bed. She fell onto the matress, fumbled for the covers and pulled them tightly over her head.
She tried to calm herself, "I'll stay here keep still shut my eyes as tight as possible and wait for help, someones bound to come soon" . she thought to her self. She had layed there for a minute or two, when the white electric wave of panic flowed right through her veins once again.
She could feel something gently tugging on the other end of the blanket trying to ease it from her grasp. She clung on for all she was worth, but eventually she lost the battle, her protective shield slid from her shoulders. As she turned to face her fears a light above her head clicked on and.
114.title: Lay down, stay still, and hope someone finds you.

choices: Sara lays her head on the table ...
Sara feels something rub against her leg ...
12.content:
"Help!" Sara shouted as loud as she could, but heard only the echo of her voice. "Please, someone help me!"

Well, laying here and shouting isn't going to help, she thought as she sit and then stood up.

"Owe," she sit back down on the bed and reached down. On the floor near her right foot was a round and smooth palm sized object. She picked it up and raised it to eye level.

She could not see it clearly, but it felt like a smooth stone of the type found on the bottom of a fast flowing river. As she rubbed the stone it began to radiate with heat and then to glow.

"So this is what I stubbed my toe on," she took a deep breath and using the glow from the stone bent down to check the floor more objects. As she did so, she noticed that she was still wearing her shoes. "How could I have stubbed my toe with my shoes on?" The stone grew cold and stopped glowing.

She begin to rub the stone again and it reacted to her caress by heating up and glowing. When she stopped rubbing the stone it would grow cold and become dark.

Still rubbing the stone she stood up and shuffled toward what she presumed was north. As she moves, she could feel objects moving out of her way. Sara walked for several minutes or perhaps hours before coming to a kitchen chair placed next to a round oak table, the sight of the chair made her tired and she sit down.
12.title: Shout and scream for help

choices: Your parents have been contacted.  If they pay the ransom you will live.
Sorry, your parents didn't pay the ransom.
13.content:
It took about three steps before Sara hit a wall, literally. Blindly following the edges of the wall, she quickly made a circle and ended up where she had started. Best she could determine, the room was a circle little more than five feet in diameter, barely enough for her to lay down in. She sank to the floor, shivering in the dampness. Cold, she put her hands in her pockets to get warm and discovered a small round object and what felt like a card.

Pulling the objects out, she moved them into what tiny light shown down and realized the one object was a tiny flashlight. With fingers growing numb with the cold, she fumbled with the button and finally got the light to turn on. She shown the light onto the card and read....
13.title: Check her pockets

choices: Use your tools to try to dig a hole in the wall
131.content:
Sarah thought for a moment. There was big word here. That IF seemed very big..She had no idea what ransom had been asked. She also had no idea how much ransom her parents could afford. She started to weep again. She started to control herself.

She looked at the card and read it over and over to herself. It did not say that she would be released. She turn off the flashlight.
She must save the meagre resources that she had. She sat for about ten minutes with her hands under her arms to get them warm and to spend time thinking of some way to escape which she now knew was her only way out. Now the room was filled with junk. Perhaps, and most likely there was something she could use to escape.

Sarah got down on her hands and knees and started to search. Anything she though was important she placed in her pocket. The rest of the junk she started to pile together in the centre of the room. After about ten minutes she removed the objects from her pocket. She had found: a broken plastic spoon, a wooden popsickle stick, half a hankerchief, a top to a jar.

You decide to ......
131.title: Your parents have been contacted.  If they pay ...

choices: reach your hand thru the hole.
1311.content:
You move to the curved wall and feel around it looking for a seam or a crack. Anything that might enable you to start to dig. Then about the time you are going to quit in frustration you find exactly what you and looking for. There is an eight inch long crack perpendicular to the floor. Almost like the edge of a brick.

Using the tools you have you start to try to make the crack bigger. Slowly by alternating the tools to scrape and wedge and pry you have loosened this brick completely, As you tug and pull with all your might it comes out of the wall. There is now a one foot by eight inch window that you have created.

As you gaze through the opening you see light on the other side. You realize you would have to remove several more bricks in order for you to get through the hole. You are not sure what you should do.

Some ideas come to mind,,,,,
1311.title: Use your tools to try to dig a hole in the wall

13112.content:
You hope there is someone who can help you able to hear your voice.

"Hello, Can anyone hear me? Hello. Can anyone hear me?" you call out hoping to attract some attention.

You wait for a few moments but there is no response. You wait a few more moments and then you try calling out again.

"Hello, Can anyone hear me? Hello. Can anyone hear me?" you call out again.

Suddenly you hear a scraping sound on the other side of the hole.

There is someone out there. You call out one more time

"Please help me I've been kidnapped"

There is a response......
13112.title: Call out thru the hole

131122.content:
The man with a deep voice cries out in pain because his partner had just hit him in the back with a chair
"We said we wouldn't talk to it!"
The other man kicks through the wall and knocks you unconsious

You wake up in...
131122.title: "We know!  we kidnapped you"

choices: As she prepared to make her way down the hole she realised someone was coming up
Just before she crawled into the hole she heard a noise behind her
132.content: Sara sighed and crumpled the piece of paper in her hand. Of course her parents hadn't paid the ransom, their millions were far more important to them than their daughter. Her kidnapper had clearly not done their research. Sara shone the flashlight around the wall inch by inch. She had got in here somehow so there was surely some way out. She suspected she may be at an advantage, for if the kidnapper hadn't known about the bitter contempt she shared with her parents then they also didn't know that her hobby was potholing. Crawling through tiny spaces created little anxiety in her and as she found the hole in the floor she grinned in anticipation of escape.
132.title: Sorry, your parents didn't pay the ransom.

14.content:
She decided to look for a light. She was in the pitch black and had no idea where she was; it seemed like a good idea. Pressing her hand against the smooth wall, the began to trace it, shuffling her hand up and down hoping to come across a light switch.

She began to move around the room, following the wall. She walked slowly, concentrating. It was only when she bumped into something that she stopped. It hit her just below the knee, sending her shin screeching. She cried out in pain, her voice echoing around the room. After a few moments the pain subsided.

What did I collide with?

She used her hands to begin feeling the object, stooping low.

After a while she finally realised it was...
14.title: Look for a light

142.content:
a chest of drawers. As she moved her hands further along, she realized that the chest of drawers actually rose to the height of her shoulders.

She felt along the top edge and estimated that it was about three feet wide in length. Then she noticed the fragrant odor of cedar, reminiscent of her cedar walk-in closet located in her own bedroom at home. How she wished she were there at this very moment!

As she moved her hands down the front of the chest of drawers, she could feel two smooth handles on each drawer, and counted a total of four drawers from top to bottom.

She wondered what was inside each drawer. Clothes, probably. That's usually what people kept inside their chest of drawers. But this was not a usual situation. Who knew what kinds of treasures or secrets could be hidden within those drawers. Perhaps she should open the drawers to find out. But was it the right thing to do?
142.title: A chest of drawers

choices: She Can See Another Human in the Cage
She Can See Her Friend in the Cage
She Can't Tell What's In The Cage and Continues to Search For the Light
144.content:
Sara felt the cold, steel bars and curled her hands around them. It was a cage. She'd collided with a cage.

It was too small to house a human, but she had a nagging feeling there was someone else in the room with her. "Hello?" she asked, her voice soft. She peered in between the bars, wondering if there was anything - or anyone - in the cage. Besides that, what was a cage actually doing in here, wherever she was?

"Is there anything in there?" she asked. She was afraid to stick her hand between the bars and feel around, not being able to see.

Sara's hands ran lightly over the cage, searching for maybe a lock or door. She felt nothing. Stumped, she was about to get up and search for the light again, when she heard a low whimpering, the only sound to break the still silence, other than her own heavy breathing.

The sound came from inside the cage and, heart pounding and palms sweating, she peered inside...
144.title: A cage

choices: Run into Searos the evil warlock
They find a door and escape
1441.content:
Gasping Sara could not believe what she saw. She was met with the deepest most beautiful sapphire eyes she had ever seen. Pained eyes that pleaded for help.

Dang it where is that door. As she continued her search around the cage for some way to gain access she wondered how on earth this boy had gotten stuffed inside a cage. Bingo! Finding a latch she struggled with it, pulling with all her strength until finally it pulled free.

As soon as the latch had sprung the door flew open and out fell the little boy. Helping him to his feet Sara removed his gag and untied his hands and feet.

"Who are you, who put you in that cage?"

The boy now free looked up at her, closed his eyes and started to grow. He was now several inches taller than her and no longer looked like a boy but the most handsome man she had ever laid eyes upon. He had shoulder length raven hair and wait a minute...pointed ears?

"Thank you for helping me my lady" the handsome stranger replied. "My name is Fela, I am the prince of the fey. The wizard Searos used a spell to shrink me then imprison me in this cage. We must hurry and find our way out of here before he realizes we have escaped."

Turning they....
1441.title: She Can See Another Human in the Cage

145.content:
After a while, she finally realized that it was a small table with an old fashioned lantern resting in the center on the top. "Finally, some light." relieved, she whispered. "Now to see where I am."

Only, to her dismay, she discovered it was an oil burning lantern and she had no means to light it with. Moaning, she placed the lantern down and began to search the table top with her hands, hoping to find a pack of matches. To her great fortune, she found some and moved to light the lantern but found it missing. "What the...!"

Frustrated, she lit a match to find the once cluttered room empty of anything! The light from the match was not strong enough for Sara to very far in any direction but she knew that there was a table in front of her a moment ago. Stumped, she failed to see the match burning away and yelped in pain as the fire burned her fingers. She shook the fire from her hands and it went out, p[lunging her into darkness once more. "This is too weird." shaken, Sara muttered.

She took a step forward, only to smack her shin against the table again, causing her to scream out of both pain and sheer frustration. "What's going on!?" she screamed.

"Don't blink." came a soft voice in response.

Startled, Sara turned around quick but saw no one. Still, she heard echoing footsteps, slowly moving towards her from another direction. "Keep moving." came the soft voice again.

Sara could hear her own heart racing as the footsteps drew closer ans wondered what she should do.
145.title: Dark echoes and illusions.

choices: Her little sister (missing for two years)
1452.content:
Sarah, deciding she had to do something decided to summon her courage and walk towards the footsteps. Each step she took echoed as well so she could only assume that the other person could hear her as well.

"Who are you?" she called. "Can you please answer me?"

No response came, just the continuing approach of echoing footsteps, in tune with her own. Sarah gulped, noticing that her footsteps seemed to match those of the person approaching her. "This is too weird." she whispered. "How do I get out of this creepy place?"

"Not the way you came in." replied the hushed voice in the darkness.

Sarah paused but did not dare to turn around in fear of tripping over something or the person approaching getting the jump on her. She was frightened and uncertain but she had to find someone who might be able to help her.

"Please, if you can hear me, say something!" she called out, louder this time.

As they neared each other, Sarah could make out the outline of a person no taller than herself and the two stopped within a few feet of each other. "For the last time, who are you?" asked Sarah, firmly.

At first, the person did not respond but it was clear he or she was visibly shaken. "No- Not y- you too!" said a familiar feminine voice, shaken with tears. "We- We'll nev- never get o- out of here!"

"What are you talking about?" asked Sarah, fumbling with the matches she had found. "Who are you!?"

Striking a match, Sarah was able to see the other person but a startled scream echoed from her throat as she saw that person was...
1452.title: She walks towards the footsteps.

14523.content:
"Anna!?" Sarah asked, surprised. "I was sure you had been kidnapped! Is this where you ended up!?"

Sadly, Anna nodded.. "This place is scary, Sarah." trembling, she said. "You- You found some matches?"

"Hold on." dropping the match before striking another, Sarah said. "Things seem to vanish and appear when I find or lose some light. Yes, I found these but lost the lantern."

Anna held up an oil lantern. "I think I found it." she said. "I tripped over it when I lost my book of matches."

Sarah steadied the lantern in Anna's hand then lit it with the match she had, lighting more of where they were and looked around the dark chamber. As before, there was nothing there. "You have been here longer than I have." turning to her sister, she said. "Any idea how big this place is?"

"It's really big but you are the first person I actually met here." shivering, Anna replied. "I hear people though... I just can't find them, except you." she hugged Sarah tightly. "Please don't leave me!"

"I won't leave you, sis." promised Sarah. "Now that I found you, I'm going to do all I can to get us home."

"You can't leave the way you came." came the whispered voice.

"Who are you!?" demanding, Sarah screamed.

"I am me and not you." replied the whispered voice.

"Cute." unimpressed, Sarah muttered. "Where are you!?"

"Everywhere and nowhere...just as you are." came the whispered reply.

"What is that supposed to mean?" mussing, Sarah asked. then a thought came to her. "Hold on to me, Anna."

Anna hugged Sarah tightly as Sarah slowly dimmed the light to the lantern to the point it was barely giving any light and found the items return to the room. Only, that was not all that she found. Standing in front of her was...
14523.title: Her little sister (missing for two years)

145231.content:
It was a small man, no taller than Anna. There was no expression on his face but his eyes showed a certain sadness. "Trapped here, as you, I am." in an almost robotic tone, he said. "Trapped longer than most, shorter than some."

"Do you know the way out of here, Mr....?" hoping, Sarah asked.

"Jon Doe, real name is lost to memory." with a bow the man said. "The way out is not the way you came in, I tried." he sighed. "Many levels to this place, there are, some worse than here."

"Are there other people here, Mr Doe?" nervous, Anna asked.

"Many people here, trapped and lost." frowning, Jon replied. "Be glad you not meet some. Food and water aplenty if you know how to find it but madness aplenty as well."

"I can defend myself." confident, Sarah said.

Jon gave a raspy laugh. "Hope you can defend with one arm." pointing at the lantern, he said. "Once released or pulled from you, all you have is lost."

"How do you find your way around?" demanding, Anna asked.

"When a door closes, a window opens." serious, Jon said. "Special fruit, I find. It help me see in the dark with one eye."

"One eye?" curious, Sarah asked.

"Can not find food if all is invisible." again pointing at the lantern, Jon replied. "As I say before, we are here and nowhere as is all that rest in the Oubliette."

"The Oubliette?" raising her eyebrows, Sarah asked. "Is that what this place is called"

"Jump back!" suddenly, Jon screamed, leaping back wards.

Sarah took Anna into her arms and jumped back, just as a dresser crashed down from above. It landed with a crash but remained intact. She looked around for Jon but he was gone again. "Keep moving." calling from the darkness, his whispered voice said. "Now it is clear to you why."

Sarah sighed, placing Anna onto her feet but keeping a hold onto her. "Looks to me that the way out is up unless that is the way in." sighing, Sarah said. "What do you think, Anna?"

Anna merely shrugged. "I have not found a single wall yet to even try." sadly, she replied.

What do they do?
145231.title: A small man.

145232.content: A little girl with long corn silk hair warm brown eyes, Sarah knew she'd seen her somewhere before but in the oubliette things weren't always what they appeared to be. Taking her sister's hand, they began to slowly ease by the small child when bright light accompanied by a loud noise causing Sarah and her sister to pass out. When Anna awoke her sister was gone but sitting across from her was the small child that had her sisters eyes.
145232.title: A small child.

1452322.content:
Getting up Anna continued to explore her surroundings "Who are you?" Anna asked softly but the little girl just looked at her like a lost litttle puppy. "It's gonna be OK" Anna said Studying her surroundings she was beginning to get a little scared herself. As her adjusted to the darkness she could see that the walls were covered with moss and vines and skeletons littered the earthen floor. "Come on help me look around" Anna said. Ever so slowly the little girl got to her feet and went to a spot near the far fall and sat back down. Shrugging her shoulders Anna turned making her way along the wall saying "Kids"

Reaching out the little girl began to clear away the dirt revealing a door in the floor. Both surprised and filled with curiosity Anna went over to the door, she was about to open it when everything went pitch black. She heard a thousand voices in the whispering in the darkness, ice cold fear skittered along her spine as began to back she tripped over something causing her to fall into shadowy darkness. She had no idea how long she'd been falling but it felt like forever. Wicked, eerie laughter following her descent. Her heart leaping in her chest and her stomach doing somersaults she finally hit the bottom. It was cushiony and wiggled and it totally creeped her out.
1452322.title: A door in the floor

14523221.content:
Choking back a scream of fear, Anna found herself surrounded by a slimy sea of bugs and skeletons it looked as though she was in some kind of a swamp area but she had been fooled by illusions before. Sitting atop a small rise was a small ogre like creature dressed like a bohemian and decorated with a shiny objects like braclets and watchets.

"Hey girlie, your gonna wanna get outta there before the creatures of the oubliette get ya" the Ogre said

"Huh, What" Anna said just as she felt something move under the muggy water.

Panic stricken Anna began to slowly turn in a circle.

"Don't say I didn't warn ya" The Ogre said getting up and lumbering off
14523221.title: surrounded by bugs and skeletons

145232211.content:
The squishy earth gave to hard-packed, sandy soil looking to the right and the right there is no sign of life. Shrugging her shoulders she picked a direction she thought the ogre went and began walking. The sand was very and with each step, puffs of dust rose from her feet, looking back she saw her footprints sinking into the soil, there was no proof that she was ever there at all. Fascinated, Anna continued on looking behind her every now and then, not paying close attention to where she's going she runs into another body of water. Whipping her head around, she saw a pale woman in a dark blue dress, her eyes are so pale a color that it was hard to if they were blue or gray or brown, and her lips were thin, and bloodless and her skin stretched taut over cheekbones.

"I have been waiting for you, Anna" she screeched, in a voice both cutting a deep. She crossed her arms across chest and seemed to grow in size.

Gasping in shock, Anna said "What are you here for"

The woman's mouth curves into a bit of smirk, but she motions for Anna to follow her. Instead of going along the edge of the water they go inland, eventually sight of the water. The air has become dry and brittle, and Anna thirst for some water. She keeps her mind on the monotony on the land around and the possibility of becoming lost in the land in this realm. Turning she sees her trail appears somewhat, and again there is no trail, no mark. Directly of them is an enormous house painted vayring stages of gray and black. Turrets and gables stumble off the roof in no particular order, Gravestones litter the front and side yards. Walking past the headstones which flicker with different names and up to two mammoth doors one pitch black and white.
145232211.title: swim for the shore

choices: will they try to find a way out
will they wait for their captors to return
15.content:
I know I'll sit and cry myself to sleep. The cold seeping into bones causing her to shiver and curl up into a fetal position to try to keep warm. She don't know how long had been asleep when she felt something tickling her face and a gruff voice whispering her name. Jerking awake, Sara sat up to fast and felt a little dizzy.

"Who's that? Who's there" Sara demanded, placing her hands on the cold, hard walls behind her.

Frowning darkly, Sara heard a heavy grunt off to her left. "Damn it, please don't hurt me.' Sara pleaded into the darkness.

"relax, your not the only one the Blue daemons threw down here." the male voice said

"How long have you been down here?" Sara asked
"I'm not real sure, I lost count after the first ten years" he said
15.title: {i}I know I'll....{/i}

info.brief_description: How creative can you get? Come to the Oubliette, stay a while... earn some GPs!
info.description:
Sara awakens in an Oubliette. A dark, dank room littered with junk. There is no natural light and no way out. What will happen to Sara?

Come to the Oubliette, stay and while and see what happens to Sara! Be as creative as you like to keep the interactive story going, let's test our writing skills and see how good we can make this! Please keep within the rating so everyone can enjoy it

Now, to the Oubliette...
